title: Given The Current Political Tensions, Our Davis Cup Team Does Not Want To Tour Pakistan And Can We Honestly Blame Them?
text:
Given The Current Political Tensions, Our Davis Cup Team Does Not Want To Tour Pakistan And Can We Honestly Blame Them?

Given The Current Political Tensions, Our Davis Cup Team Does Not Want To Tour Pakistan And Can We Honestly Blame Them?

The Indian tennis team has written to AITA on not wanting to go to play the Davis Cup clash in Pakistan. It will also appeal to the ITF for a change of venue.

A source close to AITA said that the reason for not going is the current tensions between the countries.

"The team does not want to go to Pakistan due to the deteriorating relationship between the two countries. We will wait and see what ITF says.

unsplash/representational image

The team has also written to AITA asking for the match to be played at a neutral venue. AITA will write to ITF and once again ask them for a neutral venue," an AITA source told ANI.

"The security situation will be reviewed on November 4 whether the tie can be held in Islamabad or to be shifted to a neutral venue," AITA had said in a statement.

"Following an in-depth security review of the current situation in Pakistan by independent expert security advisors, the Davis Cup Committee has taken the decision to postpone the Davis Cup Asia/Oceania Group I tie between Pakistan and India in Islamabad, due to be played on September 14-15," ITF added.

Since India scrapped Article 370, our relationship with Pakistan have gone from bad to worse and in this situation expecting players to go and play there is a little too much to ask. We can say that sports and politics do not mix, but the players are only human at the end of the day.

So can one really blame them for not wanting to go? Will they be forced to? Let's wait and watch.

With Inputs From ANI
